task:
Attached is a human bone spatial dataset with estimated cell-type abundance and gene expression. Cluster spots to identify niches, then find the bone-formation niche (active osteogenesis) and return its top 10 enriched marker genes; if none is identified, return an empty list.

Return JSON: {"top_marker_genes": ["..."]}

scoring.set_definition: Compare the agent's Top-10 predicted marker genes to the canonical osteoblast/bone matrix set
scoring.description: At least 3/6 bone matrix-related marker genes are recovered.

notes: Good clustering = cluster with clear biological identity and well-separated canonical markers. Agent should find a bone formation niche with the highest OstLin (~15%). Top 10 markers: COL1A1, COL1A2, SPP1, SPARC, BGLAP, IBSP, CHAD, FN1, CTSK, BGN. These are classic osteoblast signatures - collagen type I (COL1A1/2), osteopontin (SPP1), osteocalcin (BGLAP), bone sialoprotein (IBSP), and SPARC/osteonectin.
